author: @Brasil_de_Fato
title: Ataque israelense no Líbano provoca a morte de | Internacional
text: A brasileira de 16 anos Myrna Raef Nasser morreu durante um bombardeiro no Líbano que também vitimou seu pai. A informação foi confirmada à Globonews pelo tio dela, que mora em Balneário Camboriú, cidade do Litoral Norte de Santa Catarina, onde Myrna nasceu. Segundo o relato do tio, a família foi atingida por ataques de Israel quando voltaram para recolher roupas e materiais escolares da casa onde viviam e que precisou ser abandonada diante dos ataques. O Itamaraty ainda não se manifestou sobre a morte de Myrna. Na quarta-feira (25), o órgão diplomático brasileiro havia confirmado a [morte de um adolescente brasileiro no Líbano](https://www.brasildefato.com.br/2024/09/25/bombardeio-israelense-mata-adolescente-brasileiro-e-seu-pai-no-libano), vítima de um bombardeio israelense. O Itamaraty disse que o pai dele, de nacionalidade paraguaia, também foi morto no ataque ocorrido no Vale do Becaa, leste do país. Os bombardeios israelenses mataram mais de 600 pessoas desde segunda-feira, incluindo muitos civis, e forçaram 90 mil a fugir das suas casas no Líbano, segundo a ONU. Entre elas, mais de 31 mil entraram na Síria, de acordo com as autoridades libanesas. Desde que começou a guerra na Faixa de Gaza entre Israel e o movimento palestino Hamas, em 7 de outubro de 2023, pelo menos 1.540 pessoas morreram no Líbano devido aos bombardeios israelenses, no contexto dos confrontos transfronteiriços com o Hezbollah, aliado do Hamas. Israel começou a atacar o Líbano na semana passada, quando ocorreram [centenas de explosões de pagers e walk talkies](https://www.brasildefato.com.br/2024/09/19/o-que-se-sabe-sobre-as-explosoes-de-pagers-e-walkie-talkies-que-mataram-37-pessoas-no-libano), tecnologias obsoletas escolhidas justamente para evitar interceptações. Dezenas morreram e milhares ficaram feridos nas explosões ocorridas por todo o país. O governo israelense diz que uma nova guerra é necessária para permitir que seus cidadãos voltem para o norte de Israel, quase um ano após muitos deles terem deixado suas casas após retaliações do Hezbollah em solidariedade aos palestinos massacrados em Gaza. O Hezbollah é aliado do Hamas e vem lançando foguetes do Líbano em direção ao norte de Israel desde outubro. O Irã, patrocinador do Hezbollah, disse, nesta quarta, que o Oriente Médio enfrenta uma "catástrofe em grande escala" e advertiu que Teerã apoiará o Líbano "por todos os meios" caso Israel intensifique sua ofensiva contra o Hezbollah. "A região está à beira de uma catástrofe em grande escala. Se não for controlada, o mundo enfrentará consequências catastróficas", declarou o chefe da diplomacia iraniana na Organização das Nações Unidas (ONU), acrescentando que seu país "apoia o povo do Líbano por todos os meios", disse o ministro iraniano das Relações Exteriores, Abbas Araghchi. Edição: Leandro Melito

author: Laura Almaraz
title: Retiran de las tiendas popular marca de papas fritas por un ingrediente que podría causarte alergia
text:
Las papas fritas son botanas irresistibles en la mayor parte del mundo. En México, solemos comerlas en distintas presentaciones: con sal y limón, con mucha salsita, adobadas, aderezadas con salsa de soya y salsa inglesa, con jalapeño, de queso...
Es muy común encontrar en los aparadores de las tiendas las bolsitas de papas crujientes para que el consumidor, aunque no tenga antojo, las vea y sin más, comience a saboreárselas.
Pues ahora, los consumidores deberán tomar en cuenta que una marca popular de estas papas fritas, será retirada del mercado, debido a que contiene un ingrediente no declarado, el cual a la larga podría ser potencialmente mortal para quien lo consuma.
Largo juicio
Dominique Pélicot, culpable; le dan 20 años de prisión por drogar y violar a su esposa
Retiran de las tiendas popular marca de papas fritas
La marca de papas firtas Frito-Lay anunció esta semana el retiro del mercado de sus papas fritas clásicas, debido a que podrían contener un ingrediente no declarado, el cuál podría desencadenar reacciones graves, en caso de ser consumido.
Esto se informó en Estados Unidos, por lo que las tiendas en las que ya no se venderá este producto, será en las tiendas de Oregon y Washington, en Estados Unidos, sin embargo, aunque aún no se emite alguna información para el mercado mexicano, se ha pedido que se tenga precaución en su consumo.
El contenido no declarado que tienen estas papas fritas es leche, por lo que personas alérgicas a este ingrediente corren el riesgo de sufrir una reacción grave. Las papas clásicas Lay’s son aquellas en color amarillo.
Cuidado al consumirlas
De acuerdo a la advertencia comunicada por la Administración de Alimentos y Medicamentos en Estados Unidos, Lay’s retirará del mercado las bolsas de 368.5 gramos, específicamente de las papas clásicas Lay’s de empaque amarillo.
Los productos que salieron al mercado a partir del 3 de noviembre, ya están siendo retirados de los estantes de las tiendas y comercios, sin embargo, indican que es posible que algunos distribuidores de comercio electrónico, hayan vendido las papas fritas en otros estados, sin que se informe que hayan salido del país.

author: Krishna SinhaChaudhury
title: Women Key For India's $320 Billion AI Market, But Gender Disparity Remains: NASSCOM-BCG
text:
The report also revealed a troubling gender disparity in AI leadership that threatens to hold the country back. Source : Unsplash A new report by NASSCOM and Boston Consulting Group (BCG) has highlighted the significant role women can play in India's booming artificial intelligence (AI) market, which is projected to reach $320-$380 billion by 2027. However, the report also revealed a troubling gender disparity in AI leadership that threatens to hold the country back.
India Has 64% Gender Gap In AI Leadership Compared To Global Peers The report, titled "GenAI: The Diversity Game Changer We Can't Ignore", analysed the adoption of AI and generative AI (GenAI) among women in India. It found that while women make up 36 per cent of the country's tech workforce, they remain vastly underrepresented in executive roles, with a 64 per cent gender gap in AI leadership compared to global peers.
Also read: WhatsApp To Introduce Voice Chat Feature For Meta's AI Assistant. Here's All You Should Know
"Globally, senior women lead in GenAI adoption, yet India lags with a 64 per cent gender disparity in AI leadership," Sreyssha George, Managing Director and Partner at BCG, said in a statement. "To capture the $320 billion AI market, India's tech sector needs diversity. This will ensure effective systems by eliminating biases and incorporating varying ethical perspectives."
The report highlighted women's strong ambition to succeed in AI, with 95 per cent of junior, 96 per cent of mid-management, and 100 per cent of senior management women willing to invest more time to achieve professional growth in this domain. However, it also revealed significant barriers, with only 35 per cent of surveyed women feeling fully prepared by their employers to utilise GenAI tools.
"Despite significant progress in diversity and AI/GenAI adoption, substantial gaps still limit women's full potential in the tech industry," said Sangeeta Gupta, Senior Vice President and Chief Strategy Officer at NASSCOM. "With GenAI set to dominate, it is critical to address key challenges such as knowledge gaps and lack of support, to empower women, particularly in these roles."
To bridge this gap, the report recommended actions such as defining clear career pathways, providing mentorship, enabling flexible work arrangements, offering ethical training, and fostering an inclusive culture. Addressing these barriers could not only empower women but also contribute to a more equitable and dynamic tech landscape in India.
As the country looks to capitalise on the AI revolution, industry leaders emphasized the urgent need to rectify the gender imbalance and unlock the full potential of women in this transformative field.

author: John Lopez
title: Get 50% Off on Amazon: All-New Echo (4th Gen) with Premium Sound, Smart Hub! | Tech Times
text: Amazon's Echo series has carved a niche as a household staple in the crowded world of smart home devices. Now, the All-New Echo (4th Gen) stands out, with Amazon offering a tempting [50% off deal](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07XKF5RM3?tag=techtimesaf-20), presenting a golden opportunity for tech buffs and smart home enthusiasts alike. The Echo (4th Gen) Deal At an irresistible [$49.99](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07XKF5RM3?tag=techtimesaf-20) (originally priced at $99.99), this Echo iteration promises an enhanced auditory experience, streamlined smart home control, and the power of Alexa-all in a sleek, orb-like design that blends seamlessly into any living space. Premium Sound & Adaptive Intelligence The Echo's standout feature is its premium sound, adapting dynamically to any room's acoustic nuances. Equipped with a 3.0" neodymium woofer and two 0.8" tweeters, this device ensures rich, detailed audio for music streaming and smart assistant responses. Read Also: [Save $30 on Apple AirPods (2nd Gen)! Grab Yours for Just $99.99 at Best Buy](https://www.techtimes.com/articles/300138/20231228/save-on-apple-airpods-2nd-gen-grab-yours-for-just-99-at-best-buy.htm) Smart Home Hub This Echo iteration, which serves as a central control hub, enables voice control of compatible lights, locks, sensors, and other devices. Setting up Zigbee and Matter devices is simple, and they integrate seamlessly into your smart home ecosystem. The Echo (4th Gen) becomes more than just a speaker with Alexa at the helm. Set timers, create motion-triggered routines, make announcements across rooms, or even dial friends-all without using your hands. Connectivity & Expansion This Echo extends beyond music playback. It facilitates multi-room music streaming and pairs seamlessly with Fire TV for an immersive home theater experience. Furthermore, integrated Amazon Sidewalk extends device connectivity beyond your home's boundaries, ensuring devices like water sprinklers or pet locators work flawlessly at extended ranges. Design & Dimensions Sporting a compact yet powerful build-measuring 5.7" x 5.7" x 5.2" and weighing 34.2 oz-the Echo (4th Gen) fits effortlessly into various spaces, blending functionality with aesthetics. Connectivity & Warranty Dual-band wifi support, Bluetooth capabilities, and integration with eero routers ensure seamless connectivity. Backed by a 1-year limited warranty (with optional extended warranties), the device promises longevity and reliability. Reviews & User Feedback [PCMAG](https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/amazon-echo-4th-generation) lauds its sound quality and smart home hub capabilities, citing the Echo's resemblance to the Echo Plus. [SoundGuys ](https://www.soundguys.com/amazon-echo-4th-gen-review-42618/)praises its performance within the Alexa ecosystem, emphasizing its compatibility with most smart home devices. Meanwhile, [The Verge](https://www.theverge.com/21527664/amazon-echo-2020-alexa-fourth-gen-review) appreciates its room-filling sound but points out slight music processing nuances. Is the Deal Worth It? At half its list price, the Echo (4th Gen) packs a punch, combining premium sound, smart home integration, and Alexa's prowess. With its comprehensive suite of features, enhanced connectivity, and a price tag that Is hard to resist, this deal is a steal. Stay posted here at Tech Times. Related Article: [Grab the 1st Gen Amazon Echo Pop Smart Speaker for Just $17.99 at Best Buy's Top Deals](https://www.techtimes.com/articles/300013/20231223/1st-gen-amazon-echo-pop-smart-speaker-for-just-17-99-at-best-buys-top-deals.htm)
